intro: Gilia truncata, commonly known as the cutleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are often deeply lobed or cut, giving it a distinctive appearance. Gilia truncata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
